emuInput.TitMainTitle: Wedding party members, including from left: Beatrice Williams, Kathryn Bolden, unknown, Bill Carter, Marty Sloan, Harry Bobo, and Herbert Douglass, standing underneath awning in front of Holy Cross Church for Williams - Brice wedding
emuInput.CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, National Edition, July 18, 1942, pg. 8 reads: "The Wedding Of The Year...Pittsburgh has never witnessed a prettier wedding ceremony and reception than the rites held for Miss Minerva Williams, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Stanley Williams and John Edwin Brice, son of Mrs. Robert Turnbull, all of Pittsburgh. Shown at the reception are the parents of the bride, Mrs. Williams wore a gown of black marquisette with bands of real lace over a pink satin slip.  Mr. Williams, one of Pittsburgh's most successful businessmen, is shown with his lovely wife in top left photo.  Center, the bride, Mrs. John Edwin Brice (nee Minerva Williams).  Her veil of illusion is caught with a real orchid.  At right: The bridal party.  The girls are, left to right: Frances Moore, Kathryn Bolden, Beatrice Williams, sister of the bride and maid of honor; Mary McNeal, cousin of the bride, and Suzanne Patterson.  The men, left to right: Harry Bobo, outstanding heavyweight king of Pittsburgh, who was the best man, Mar[t]y Sloan, Herbert Douglass, and Bill Carter.  The newlyweds are shown at right, in beautifully decorated Loendi Club, where the reception was held  last Tuesday evening, following the wedding ceremony at the Church of the Holy Cross.  They have returned from a honeymoon trip in Cleveland, Ohio. - Harris Photos."
